text: During the first presidential debate at the University of Hofstra, Hillary Clinton denounced armed violence, especially because it affected young African-Americans. She said: "The arms epidemic is the leading cause of death among young African Americans, more than the following nine combined." This is the claim that Clinton has made before, and it is true. We found the relevant data on the site of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Using this search form, we collected data on the 10 most common causes of death of African-American men and boys aged 15-24 years, in 2014: 2,256 firearms-related homicides in 2014, compared with 2,119 deaths in the following nine groups combined.
